Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of job losses on women under Obama by stating that women account for 92.3 percent of the jobs lost.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides national employment figures without considering other factors that may have contributed to job losses.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the job losses under Obama were directly caused by his policies without considering other factors such as the global economic recession that started before he took office.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the job losses, such as changes in the industry composition or economic trends that were not solely influenced by Obama's policies.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that women did not account for 92.3 percent of the jobs lost under Obama, as determined by fact-checkers.
